intro: Haemanthus eetveldeanus, commonly known as the Eetvelde bulbous plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and striking inflorescence. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its foliage consists of strap-like, evergreen leaves that remain throughout the year. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate watering, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers.
